content:

content: If that's the quality of art we can expect from your fangame, then I can't imagine it being anything other than incredibly impressive. It's certainly a big jump from the graphics you posted a few months ago. Nice work!

title: Re: A bip.
content:
Funny thing about that, was that was what I did in like, ten minutes.

Actually, I'm at a dilemma as far as my graphics go for my fangame. I just realized that with game maker, I made all my graphics disproportional to what looks best on GameMaker. So right now, I'm really wondering if I should re-make all my graphics. I know that sounds like a huge task... And I'm not going to lie, it is huge, but honestly, my graphics currently look like crap on GM. I forgot to measure into effect the blurriness of GM, and that it would create trails for too fast of movement. I dunno, but I think I may have to. (Not to mention that there's a lot of fun shit I wanted to do, but couldn't at first because GM couldn't handle it until the most recent version of GM came out a few months ago. Further more, I was having huge resolution problems... meh, I don't really quite have the energy to do it, but I know it needs to be done.)


The good news is that, if I do decide to do it, it'll probably keep my interest more focussed for a bit longer... But, it postpones my demo only further. Also, my graphics would be ten times more kick-ass than they are now. Other good news is that since I'm getting my facebook account, I'll try to regularly show you guys what's up in my game. (Not everything, mind you, but what I think may need critiquing)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: A bip.
content:
Well, if your graphics would be ten times better, then do it!----

title: insert subject here
content: I believe Globox tried that, and eventually gave up and moved back to Game Maker.

title: Re: insert subject here
content:
I tried to, Shadow Master, but as I recall, the only person I knew at the time who was using the programs I was using decided he was going get himself lost from the internet for four months; and as they say in show biz, the show must go on. So I moved to GM.

Da Vince --yeah, that's the bad thing about GameMaker. I should have made my graphics larger (Which I intended to do about x4, now only x2), but GM just shits all over that. It makes them all fuzzy and gross. And just x2 wasn't big enough... So I have to adapt.

Now, with that aside, I've done some shells (non-detailed/no color frames) of a new Keen. I'm pretty satisfied with the results, but quite honestly... I can't say as though I'm going to be done with anything any time soon. So, while it will, hopefully, look completely kick ass... It's going to prolong my fan game even longer --my demo's target date before was to have it released early June or July. Now, it'll be probably mid-August at the earliest.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: hmm
content:
What software did you use to craft that? What's the poly count? Does it have bones?

I like the way you modelled the neck and the back of the head, especially--gives the whole creature a mundane, labor-intensive and bored look. I really like it!

title: GoPlat bip
content:
Thanks [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I think I posted it somewhere in here before quite some time ago, but got 0 reactions to that and I think it was even removed (I don't know for what reason), so I thought I'd just post it again in this thread judging it to be relevant. ;]

I've modeled it in 3ds max 4.2, and textured it in Photoshop 5.5. More info on the model can be found here:
[url=http://www.tabun.nl/3d_work_view.php?view=m_sliders_goplat]www.tabun.nl/3d_work_view...ers_goplat[/url]

It has no bones, for I didn't intend for it to be animated (it was to be used as a Sliders hoverboard, Sliders being a Q3 mod wherein you'd race around on back-to-the-future-style flying skateboards -- sadly that mod died, so it was never used [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] -- if anyone here can find a use for it, feel free to contact me)

I'm having some more 'keenish fun' now (XViD previews), but that is not bip/gik related, I'm afraid:
[url=http://www.tabun.nl/tmp/dopefish_pre_a.avi]www.tabun.nl/tmp/dopefish_pre_a.avi[/url]
[url=http://www.tabun.nl/tmp/dopefish_pre_b.avi]www.tabun.nl/tmp/dopefish_pre_b.avi[/url]
(first 13 frames = swim loop)

Edit: and it has a skin, too:
[img]http://www.tabun.nl/tmp/dopefish_skin.jpg[/img]

title: Re: GoPlat bip
content:
Tabun your work looks amazing, I love good 3D art like yours [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

The Dopefish animation is the most accurate 3D adaption to the original Dopefish movement I've seen.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Originally posted by DaVince21:

+++ should use in Keen 64![hr][/quote]

Well it's definitely beyond the standard of Keen 64 art.

However, it's the wrong game, being that Keen 64 is a remake of Keen 1. But nonetheless, I am inspired, and I have considered raising my art to your level of quality, (such as the shading, complete texturing of the models, etc).

title: Re: GoPlat bip
content:
Thanks for the kind words -- and I don't mind providing inspiration, if it so happens to work out.

As for your consideration, I strongly suggest you do! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I've been modelling for some time now, but I've only recently had time to play around with Keen-material. It's great fun to go beyond the basics, because id's monster designs are not only great by themselves, but allow plenty of room for artistic freedom in bringing them up to (more or less) present-day standards.
If you need pointers or information regarding the way I work, I'd be happy to provide those.

title: Re: GoPlat bip
content:
That's awesome, thank you, I greatly appreciate it, and I might take you up on your offer.

If I was making Keen 4 or 6 I would definately use you stuff, even though my original idea was that if I was to make any 2nd-Gen Keen game in 3D I'd go with Cel-Shading, but after seeing your stuff I'm not so sure about that [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: GoPlat bip
content:
Oh, you seem to be a really experienced 3D artist. Definitively you could have some use in projects such as the Duke Nukem 3D High-resolution Pack.

The model of the Bip is particularily accurate and detailed. I can even see the thingie at the middle of its belly, and the mouth lips.

Ah, too bad my game engine is and will be only designed for 2D games.------------------------------

title: Re: GoPlat bip
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Originally posted by Tabun:

If you need pointers or information regarding the way I work, I'd be happy to provide those.[hr][/quote]

I hope this isn't too much to ask, but I guess one thing that would help is to see the texture file of the Bip model privately. You can even put a watermark on it, as I just want to see how you do the shading and such, I have no interest in the original texture itself, but in the technique.

And if it is too much to ask that's ok, I understand.

But if you're alright with all of that, you can send me the texture via email (in however format you'd like to present it) to: lava89 (at) gmail (dot) com.

Many, many thanks,
LAVA89
